commentsummaries.commentsummary: Smart, funny spoof that is impossible not to like!
Fun, memorable sci-fi comedy has lots of personality thanks to director, composer, and two lead actors.
One of the best sci-fi comedies ever made.
Funny Sci-Fi. As Good As Ghostbusters.
Men in Black: The Galaxy Defenders

show.description: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Linda Fiorentino, Vincent D'Onofrio. A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extra terrestrial interactions on planet earth.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Rushed and Poorly Produced WWII Fare
A really bad movie
Reasonable desert war movie
A weak film of Henry Hathaway.
The Shakespearean Action Hero

show.description: Directed by Henry Hathaway. With Richard Burton, John Colicos, Clinton Greyn, Wolfgang Preiss. Captain Foster plans on raiding German-occupied Tobruk with hand-picked commandos, but a mix-up leaves him with a medical unit containing a Quaker conscientious objector. Despite all odds they succeed with their mission. On the way they pick up and drug the mistress of an Italian general, blow up the entire fuel supply for the Afrika Korps, and swap philatelic gossip with Field Marshal Erwin ...

commentsummaries.commentsummary: People are so stupid!
At least 50% of the audience liked it.
Revelation...the humorless need to take a breath and see this for what it is.
Sad
"Well Raspucia, you have been eating so much lately..."

show.description: Directed by Brian Robbins. With Eddie Murphy, Thandie Newton, Terry Crews, Clifton Powell. A mild-mannered guy, who is engaged to a monstrous woman, meets the woman of his dreams, and schemes to find a way to be with her.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: A very relevant movie for me
P.S. Move On
Total tearjerker falsely billed as a romantic comedy
Great Movie, Must See Romantic Comedy.
An overall enjoyable chick flick and good date movie

show.description: Directed by Richard LaGravenese. With Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler, Harry Connick Jr., Lisa Kudrow. A young widow discovers that her late husband has left her 10 messages intended to help ease her pain and start a new life.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: A novel without a hero becomes a film without any bite
Great film, if you haven't read the book
Vanity Fair without the Vanita, Vanitatas
Thackery goes Hollywood
Disappointing, if not disastrous

show.description: Directed by Mira Nair. With Reese Witherspoon, Romola Garai, James Purefoy, Jonathan Rhys Meyers. Growing up poor in London, Becky Sharp (Witherspoon) defies her poverty-stricken background and ascends the social ladder alongside her best friend, Amelia.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Seagal fans rejoice? Ahhh, not quite, but a step in the right direction
Too much love for this film.
Slick garbage
One of the better Seagal films of recent years...
Absolutely Dreadful

show.description: Directed by Don E. FauntLeRoy. With Steven Seagal, Jacqueline Lord, Roger Guenveur Smith, Luke Goss. A mercenary gets involved in a mission that threatens the lives of his kin. In order to succeed, he must break into one of the most wellguarded prisons in Eastern Europe and free the son of the most notorious drug lord in the world today.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Disgraceful,this trilogy gets worse as it goes on,
A Nutshell Review: Alvin and the Chipmunks: Chip-Wrecked
Look in the Thesaurus under Execrable, Then Go Down from There
If you've never liked the singing and dancing Chipmunk and Chipette trio, you're certainly not going to after this rehash of a sequel
Thank goodness for Theodore!

show.description: Directed by Mike Mitchell. With Justin Long, Jesse McCartney, Jason Lee, David Cross. Playing around while aboard a cruise ship, the Chipmunks and Chipettes accidentally go overboard and end up marooned in a tropical paradise. They discover their new turf is not as deserted as it seems.

titles.title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Surprisingly imaginative, original and very funny
Not only does justice to the book but takes its own sweep of originality and charm
Fantastic!
Possibly the funniest animated movie I've ever seen
Sublimely Ridiculous

show.description: Directed by Phil Lord, Christopher Miller. With Anna Faris, Bill Hader, Bruce Campbell, James Caan. A local scientist is often regarded as a failure until he invents a machine that can make food fall from the sky. But little does he know, that things are about to take a turn for the worst.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: A good action-adventure film with great special effects
It is what it is......fun
Holy Cremoly!
Air Farce Number One
Fun to watch, if you do not make a big deal out of technical accuracy.

show.description: Directed by Wolfgang Petersen. With Harrison Ford, Gary Oldman, Glenn Close, Wendy Crewson. Hijackers seize the plane carrying the President of the United States and his family, but he - an ex-soldier - works from hiding to defeat them.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: "Death Wish" brought to the 21st century.
pretty good
Do not listen to all the negative reviews!
Vengeance, pure and simple
Wan delivers in a non-horror-film

show.description: Directed by James Wan. With Kevin Bacon, John Goodman, Kelly Preston, Garrett Hedlund. Nick Hume is a mild-mannered executive with a perfect life, until one gruesome night he witnesses something that changes him forever. Transformed by grief, Hume eventually comes to the disturbing conclusion that no length is too great when protecting his family.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: I really enjoyed this movie, I am a Danielle Steel fan now!
Changes Makes for Good Soap Gossip ***
What a load of hooey!
like in changes the channel

show.description: Directed by Charles Jarrott. With Cheryl Ladd, Michael Nouri, Chris Gartin, Randee Heller. Beautiful and successful television news anchor Melanie Adams falls in love with renowned heart transplant surgeon Peter Hallam. After a whirlwind courtship, they marry. Each has children from previous marriages. The strain of a new marriage and attempts to blend a family jeopardize their happiness.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Still Good!
Gone but not forgotten
an unusual and very touching drama.
An unusual love triangle.
A "Feel Good" Movie

show.description: Directed by Michael Miller. With Robert Urich, Stacy Haiduk, Darren McGavin, Susan Sullivan. Robert Urich as a lawyer in love with a woman who's married to a dying millionaire.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Lisa Rinna makes a good movie even better
George Hamilton & Lisa Rinna Were Great!

show.description: Directed by George Kaczender. With George Hamilton, Lisa Rinna, Robert Hays, Maurice Godin. Vanished tells the story of a man and woman faced with an almost unthinkable tragedy-the mysterious abduction of their son.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Okay Movie, nothing to write home about.
gentle and inoffensive made for TV movie.
Heartfelt and very sweet, romance fans will like this one
Pretty Dire
OK

show.description: Directed by Michael Miller. With John Ritter, Polly Draper, Kevin Kilner, Michael Lembeck. Bill Thigpen, writer producer of the No.1 daytime TV drama was so busy watching his career soar that he never noticed his marriage collapse. Now, nine years later, living alone in Hollywood, even without his wife and kids, his life and success are still reasonably sweet.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: A Harlequin movie
A Mysterious Harlequin Romance
Full of suspense, good scenery, awesome choice of Chris Potter for lead.
Enjoyable but does not follow the plot of Krentz's book
Not a bad movie, some wooden aspects, but otherwise enjoyable

show.description: Directed by Vic Sarin. With Chris Potter, Chandra West, Paula Abdul, Art Hindle. An engaged woman, who has an art gallery with a friend, receives a package from Mexico sent by her uncle. A lot of people seem to be interested in this package, including a handsome man. Who can be trusted?

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Paint Job
Touching father / son / grandson story
Not bad to watch.
Decent Thriller Drama
nice film

show.description: Directed by Philip Martin. With John Travolta, Christopher Plummer, Tye Sheridan, Abigail Spencer. A thief works with his father and son to forge a painting by Monet and steal the original. Together, they plan the heist of their lives.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Not so much stupid as boring with an occasional giggle

Good one-liners and gags, zero plot.
Better to stare at the wall than watch Ted 2
Not as funny as the first, the magic is wearing off

show.description: Directed by Seth MacFarlane. With Mark Wahlberg, Seth MacFarlane, Amanda Seyfried, Jessica Barth. Newlywed couple Ted and Tami-Lynn want to have a baby, but in order to qualify to be a parent, Ted will have to prove he's a person in a court of law.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: A dark and brooding affair, Dying of the Light plays out exactly as the title suggests.
Another Nicholas Cage in Romania crapfest
The ear was literally the most fascinating part of this movie
Probably won't see much of Cage after this flop
Worse movie I had seen in a while

show.description: Directed by Paul Schrader. With Nicolas Cage, Anton Yelchin, Alexander Karim, Irène Jacob. When a devastating illness threatens to end Evan Lake's career in the C.I.A., he goes rogue to hunt down a terrorist who tortured him during a mission gone awry years ago.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Odd, dark, and very unpredictable
A little sincerity pierces through this oddball mumblecore comedy.
The Sleepover
Sometimes, at a party you don't really know whats going on... Then, when you think a little later and the only word you can say is F*****************CK!
Exactly what you'd expect and less

show.description: Directed by Patrick Brice. With Adam Scott, Taylor Schilling, Jason Schwartzman, Judith Godrèche. Alex, Emily, and their son, RJ, are new to Los Angeles. A chance meeting at the park introduces them to the mysterious Kurt, Charlotte, and Max. A family "playdate" becomes increasingly interesting as the night goes on.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Child soldiers in a surreal commune fortress
Richly Layered
Scary Utopia, brilliant acting.
A dark and intelligent, character driven film.
A flawed gem; technically amazing but perhaps too ambiguous for its own good

show.description: Directed by Ariel Kleiman. With Vincent Cassel, Jeremy Chabriel, Florence Mezzara, Esther Blaser-Tokarev. Alexander, a boy who has been raised in a sequestered commune, finds that his increasing unwillingness to fall in line puts him on a collision course with Gregori, the society's charismatic and domineering leader.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Intense, Entertaining and Emotional
A farewell with a bang.

show.description: Directed by James Wan. With Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Dwayne Johnson, Jason Statham. Deckard Shaw seeks revenge against Dominic Toretto and his family for his comatose brother.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Something Old, Something New

show.description: Directed by Bharat Nalluri. With Kit Harington, Peter Firth, Jennifer Ehle, Michael Wildman. When a terrorist escapes custody during a routine handover, Will Holloway must team with disgraced MI5 Intelligence Chief Harry Pearce to track him down before an imminent terrorist attack on London.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Has IMDb been hacked?

show.description: Directed by Nicholas Stoller. With Seth Rogen, Rose Byrne, Zac Efron, Lisa Kudrow. After they are forced to live next to a fraternity house, a couple with a newborn baby do whatever they can to take them down.

dammit Janet!

show.description: Directed by Jim Sharman. With Tim Curry, Susan Sarandon, Barry Bostwick, Richard O'Brien. A newly engaged couple have a breakdown in an isolated area and must pay a call to the bizarre residence of Dr. Frank-N-Furter.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Excellent story with some artistic license

show.description: Directed by James Gartner. With Josh Lucas, Derek Luke, Austin Nichols, Jon Voight. In 1966, Texas Western coach Don Haskins led the first all-black starting line-up for a college basketball team to the NCAA national championship.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Utterly Fantastic
the best "family movie" i've ever seen!

show.description: Directed by Danny DeVito. With Danny DeVito, Rhea Perlman, Mara Wilson, Embeth Davidtz. Story of a wonderful little girl, who happens to be a genius, and her wonderful teacher vs. the worst parents ever and the worst school principal imaginable.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: ~A Child's Fantasy, an Adult's Memory~

show.description: Directed by Steven Spielberg. With Henry Thomas, Drew Barrymore, Peter Coyote, Dee Wallace. A troubled child summons the courage to help a friendly alien escape Earth and return to his home-world.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Definitely underrated!

Review
Classic Action Movie
Slick and powerful.

show.description: Directed by Michael Bay. With Sean Connery, Nicolas Cage, Ed Harris, John Spencer. A mild-mannered chemist and an ex-con must lead the counterstrike when a rogue group of military men, led by a renegade general, threaten a nerve gas attack from Alcatraz against San Francisco.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: 20-somethings and the Goonies
Goonies r good enough

show.description: Directed by Richard Donner. With Sean Astin, Josh Brolin, Jeff Cohen, Corey Feldman. In order to save their home from foreclosure, a group of misfits set out to find a pirate's ancient treasure.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: It just gets funnier every time I watch it

show.description: Directed by Robert Zemeckis. With Meryl Streep, Bruce Willis, Goldie Hawn, Isabella Rossellini. When a woman learns of an immortality treatment, she sees it as a way to outdo her long-time rival.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Mr. Mojo rising

show.description: Directed by Jay Roach. With Mike Myers, Heather Graham, Michael York, Robert Wagner. Dr. Evil is back...and has invented a new time machine that allows him to go back to the 60's and steal Austin Powers's mojo, inadvertently leaving him "shagless".

Directed by Michael Shuman. With Jonathan Malaer, Renee Montgomery, Warren Helbach, Thomas Parry. When Jonathon Novak gets the opportunity of a lifetime, he must decide between work and life in this dramatic piece. "Who's life are we living?"

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Great Movie ! Can't Believe all the Abysmal Reviews
pretty good movie to watch with kids

show.description: Directed by Chris Columbus. With Adam Sandler, Kevin James, Michelle Monaghan, Peter Dinklage. When aliens misinterpret video feeds of classic arcade games as a declaration of war, they attack the Earth in the form of the video games.

Not as funny as I remember
Check your brain, then get ready to laugh
Silly but satisfying

show.description: Directed by Frank Coraci. With Adam Sandler, Kathy Bates, Henry Winkler, Fairuza Balk. A waterboy for a college football team discovers he has a unique tackling ability and becomes a member of the team.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Crackerjack Thriller with a message...

show.description: Directed by Tony Scott. With Will Smith, Gene Hackman, Jon Voight, Lisa Bonet. A lawyer becomes a target by a corrupt politician and his NSA goons when he accidentally receives key evidence to a serious politically motivated crime.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Formulaic but entertaining, in its own way, with an excellent cast doing excellent work.

show.description: Directed by Antoine Fuqua. With Jake Gyllenhaal, Rachel McAdams, Oona Laurence, Forest Whitaker. Boxer Billy Hope turns to trainer Tick Wills to help him get his life back on track after losing his wife in a tragic accident and his daughter to child protection services.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Neeson is the vodka of James Bond's martini
Probably the fastest 93 minutes of my life !
Surprinsingly good - definitely must see
Surprising original exciting action movie
brilliantly executed film

show.description: Directed by Pierre Morel. With Liam Neeson, Maggie Grace, Famke Janssen, Leland Orser. A retired CIA agent travels across Europe and relies on his old skills to save his estranged daughter, who has been kidnapped while on a trip to Paris.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Seen worse. Seen a whole lot worse.
Saw an advance screening and actually enjoyed it!
Definitely a must see movie

show.description: Directed by Adam Brooks. With Ryan Reynolds, Rachel Weisz, Abigail Breslin, An Nguyen. A political consultant tries to explain his impending divorce and past relationships to his 11-year-old daughter.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: I've Saved my Ten for This Film

Bring Kleenex. Lots of Kleenex.

show.description: Directed by Josh Boone. With Shailene Woodley, Ansel Elgort, Nat Wolff, Laura Dern. Two teenage cancer patients begin a life-affirming journey to visit a reclusive author in Amsterdam.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Coyote Ugly Was A "Feel Good" Film

show.description: Directed by David McNally. With Piper Perabo, Adam Garcia, John Goodman, Maria Bello. Aspiring songwriter Violet Sanford, after getting a job at a women-run NYC bar that teases its male patrons, comes out of her shell.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: How to create something out of nothing? Ask Mark Andrus and Jim L. Brooks

This comedy is as good as it gets!

show.description: Directed by James L. Brooks. With Jack Nicholson, Helen Hunt, Greg Kinnear, Cuba Gooding Jr.. A single mother/waitress, a misanthropic author, and a gay artist form an unlikely friendship after the artist is assaulted in a robbery..

commentsummaries.commentsummary: An incredibly powerful film!
An important hardened lesson in resilience and when to stop measuring up to your mentor. Whiplash is a captivating study of ambition.
Tension, tension, tension!
Wow just wow. Easily one of the greatest films of the year
They could have done better

show.description: Directed by Damien Chazelle. With Miles Teller, J.K. Simmons, Melissa Benoist, Paul Reiser. A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

titles.title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Both uplifting and disheartening, sometimes both at once
Touching and moving, a great cinematic experience
Poetic - Powerful - Simple: The Greatness of Cuckoo's Nest.
A great order vs. chaos tale that everyone can relate to
"What an excellent movie" is all that went through my mind after seeing this masterpiece

show.description: Directed by Milos Forman. With Jack Nicholson, Louise Fletcher, Michael Berryman, Peter Brocco. A criminal pleads insanity after getting into trouble again and once in the mental institution rebels against the oppressive nurse and rallies up the scared patients.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Kubrick's Gift to us all. "I have seen one or two things in my life but never, never anything like this."
An impressive film with a bad marketing campaign
Be prepared to think

show.description: Directed by Stanley Kubrick. With Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman, Todd Field, Sydney Pollack. A New York City doctor, who is married to an art curator, pushes himself on a harrowing and dangerous night-long odyssey of sexual and moral discovery after his wife admits that she once almost cheated on him.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: A cute little film

show.description: Directed by Elizabeth Allen Rosenbaum. With Joey King, Selena Gomez, Bridget Moynahan, John Corbett. An adventurous young girl uses her imagination to escape her reality, that is quickly spinning out of reach.

show.description: Directed by William Friedkin. With Matthew McConaughey, Emile Hirsch, Juno Temple, Thomas Haden Church. When a debt puts a young man's life in danger, he turns to putting a hit out on his evil mother in order to collect the insurance.

titles.title: For the Future: The Irvine Fertility Scandal

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Typical movie of the week, but with an important message

show.description: Directed by David Hugh Jones. With Marilu Henner, Randle Mell, Linda Lavin, Castulo Guerra. John and Debbie Challender have been trying to conceive a child for ten years. Because this hasn't worked they adopted a son, but Debbie still feels she has missed out on something not knowing what it's like to feel life inside of her. They decide to seek treatment from a so-called 'miracle doctor' Ash at Irvine University. Although John doesn't like the doctor they go ahead with the treatment, ...

commentsummaries.commentsummary: The Real Story behind this movie
3 words!!
Not as good as the real story.
Coach Russell Stager

show.description: Directed by Michael Scott. With Jaclyn Smith, Diana Scarwid, Timothy Carhart, Ron Canada. A high-school basketball coach uncovers a shocking secret about his new wife that she is willing to kill to protect.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: one of the best movies of the decade
A Film Only Russia Could Make
Resonates long afterward
Special in every way
A film of rare beauty and authenticity

show.description: Directed by Andrey Zvyagintsev. With Vladimir Garin, Ivan Dobronravov, Konstantin Lavronenko, Nataliya Vdovina. In the Russian wilderness, two brothers face a range of new, conflicting emotions when their father - a man they know only through a single photograph - resurfaces.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: A woman tracks down her ex husband

show.description: Directed by John Nicolella. With Donna Mills, Jack Scalia, Chris Mulkey, Jenny Lewis. A woman's husband leaves her and their three daughters. Years later she sets out to find him and get him to pay back child support.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: one of the best performances in a TV drama for a long time
Well-handled but a bit unnecessary

show.description: Directed by Robin Sheppard. With Sarah Lancashire, Amber Wollen, Timothy Spall, Geoffrey Greenhill. A drama based on the true story of Angela Cannings, who was wrongly convicted of killing two of her children, on the basis of "expert witness" evidence about Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (Cot Death Syndrome) which has since been discredited.

titles.title: Against Her Will: The Carrie Buck Story

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Good effort by Marlee Matlin and Melissa Gilbert

show.description: Directed by John David Coles. With Marlee Matlin, Melissa Gilbert, Peter Frechette, Pat Hingle. Carrie Buck is a young intellectually disabled woman who is persuaded to fight against the courts for custody of her newborn daughter after it's taken from her since Carrie has been declared mentally incompetent to raise her baby by herself.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Those Holocaust Days
Could have/should have been better
Enjoyable film with beautiful footage of Israel. Kirk Douglas always a scene stealer.

show.description: Directed by Jack Smight. With Kirk Douglas, Robert Clary, Pam Dawber, Eric Douglas. Joe Rabin is a Holocaust survivor. After the war he went to America, married someone and had a family. Today, he is on his way to Israel for a reunion of Holocaust survivors. It seems that he has another reason for going. It seems like during the war, he had a girlfriend and they were separated and she was pregnant. He has never found out what happened to her, or their baby, he hopes to find out ...

commentsummaries.commentsummary: One of top 100 greatest films of all time! and it's based on a play!
enthralling
Astonishing...
As a former salesman, this is the most realistic movie ever
The plight of the working man

show.description: Directed by James Foley. With Al Pacino, Jack Lemmon, Alec Baldwin, Alan Arkin. An examination of the machinations behind the scenes at a real estate office.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Through the eyes of a child
snapshot of a time past
A Funny, poignant, truthful, and enjoyable child's-eye view of London during The Blitz.
tune in tonight
A perennial delight

show.description: Directed by John Boorman. With Sarah Miles, David Hayman, Sebastian Rice-Edwards, Geraldine Muir. A semi-autobiographical project by John Boorman about a nine year old boy called Bill as he grows up in London during the blitz of World War 2. For a young boy, this time in history was more of an adventure, a total upheaval of order, restrictions and discipline. The liberating effect of the war on the women left behind. And the joy when Hitler blows up your school.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Strange customs
A timeless epic!
Sir Walter would be proud
New and above average adaptation derived from Sir Walter Scott classic novel
Beats the 1952 version by several leagues

show.description: Directed by Douglas Camfield. With James Mason, Anthony Andrews, Sam Neill, Michael Hordern. This is a remake of Walter Scott's Ivanhoe. Ivanhoe, a worthy and noble knight, the champion of justice returns to England after the holy wars. He finds England under the reign of Prince John and his henchmen and finds himself being involved in the power-struggle for the throne of England. Will justice prevail and will all fair ladies in distress be rescued?
A fertility clinic mix-up leaves the clinic's administration frantic to bring together two unlikely People. A public school teacher from India and a Manhattan D.A.--by any means necessary.

show.description: Directed by Brian Grant. With Hart Bochner, Joe Don Baker, Chelsea Field, Brett Cullen. Condominium residents are terrified when they learn that two of their neighbors have been brutally raped and that the culprit may be living in their midst. A police manhunt ensues. One officer, who actually lives in the complex, is particularly troubled, for not only do the incidents cause his wife to admit that she was a victim of date rape, he is also the one who had a chance to kill the rapist...

show.description: Directed by Anthony Hickox. With David Carradine, Morgan Brittany, Bruce Campbell, Jim Metzler. Reclusive vampires lounge in a lonely American town. They wear sun cream to protect themselves. A descendant of Van Helsing arrives with hilarious consequences.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Not as good as the first
Good sequel to "The Lost World".

A very well produced sequel to the 1992 film
Enjoyable sequel to 1992's Lost World

show.description: Directed by Timothy Bond. With John Rhys-Davies, David Warner, Eric McCormack, Nathania Stanford. When Belgian scientist Bertram Hammonds arrives in the Lost World to drill for crude oil, Professors Challenger and Summerlee of the return to the Lost World plateau.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: An impressive achievement considering recent years, Worst Seagal film ever!!

show.description: Directed by Po-Chih Leong. With Steven Seagal, Ida Nowakowska, Agnieszka Wagner, Matt Schulze. Billy Ray Lansing, a former covert agent turned survivalist, discovers that the foster program he is using to help a young girl is actually a human trafficking network. Lancing heads overseas to find the girl and shut down the operation.

show.description: Directed by Richard Crudo. With Steven Seagal, Tanoai Reed, Jenna Harrison, Danny Midwinter. When most of the population of Earth is infected with a virus and transformed into flesh eaters and blood drinking creatures, a group of hunters led by Tao chases the vampire zombies to eliminate them. Six non-infected survivors try to find the exit of an abandoned hospital crowded with the infected creatures, and Tao and his group help them. Meanwhile, the military command is ready to bomb the ...

commentsummaries.commentsummary: The powerful, true story of what REALLY happened on the River Kwai during WW2.
A "War" Movie That's About Values, Not War
powerful story
Deeply absorbing tale of the power to forgive
Powerful in the way that Schindler's List was powerful

show.description: Directed by David L. Cunningham. With Robert Carlyle, Kiefer Sutherland, Ciarán McMenamin, Mark Strong. A true story about four Allied POWs who endure harsh treatment from their Japanese captors during World War II while being forced to build a railroad through the Burmese jungle. Ultimately they find true freedom by forgiving their enemies. Based on the true story of Ernest Gordon.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Well worth seeing and preserving
Solid but somewhat overlong morale-booster
A good film
Good take on the Norwegian spirit
Not as good as EDGE OF DARKNESS (1943), but still entertaining...

show.description: Directed by John Farrow. With Paul Muni, Anna Lee, Lillian Gish, Cedric Hardwicke. A gentle widower, enraged at Nazi atrocities against his peaceful Norwegian fishing village, escapes to Britain and returns leading a commando force against the oppressors.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Decent Little Italian-Spanish Action Flick
Passable Spaghetti/Paella War movie co-produced by Italy/Spain and filmed in Spanish outdoors
Routine movie featuring the great Kinski
CHURCHILL'S LEOPARDS (Maurizo Pradeaux, 1970) **1/2
"Churchill's Leopards" keeps its heroes on the spot

show.description: Directed by Maurizio Pradeaux. With Richard Harrison, Pilar Velázquez, Giacomo Rossi Stuart, Frank Braña. The mission: The British have to carry out a plan hatched by Churchill himself to blow up a French dam, by bringing in commandos led by the twin brother of the German commander.

show.description: Directed by Curt A. Sindelar. With Christopher Serrone, Michael Conner Humphreys, Philip De Lorenzo, Kyle Erickson. Three companies of paratroopers travel in a deadly mission to France to prepare the drop zone for the airborne attack on the D-Day. They have to install an Eureka transmitter and searchlight to guide the planes in the Normandy invasion.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Not very good, ya

Good effort, but ultimately fails.

show.description: Directed by Eric Colley. With Brett Cullen, Cody Kasch, Gilles Marini, Ryan Merriman. World War II: Shortly after D-Day, three American soldiers and two Army Corps nurses are stranded behind enemy lines. They take a high-ranking German officer as their prisoner and try to orchestrate an escape.

commentsummaries.commentsummary: Entertaining, but rough around the edges

Not the greatest, yet far from the worst WWII film

Great in it's class

show.description: Directed by Adrian Vitoria. With Sean Bean, Danny Dyer, Aksel Hennie, Izabella Miko. The true story of the formation of Ian Fleming's 30 Commando unit, a precursor for the elite forces in the U.K.

show.description: Directed by Thomas Makowski. With Victoria Pratt, Michael Adamthwaite, Trace Adkins, Steve Bacic. Trace Adkins (The Lincoln Lawyer), Ron Perlman (TV's "Sons of Anarchy") and Brendan Penny (Ring Of Fire) star in this gritty and riveting re-imagining of the classic Western saga. Raised by powerful cattle baron Judge Henry (Perlman), South, aka "The Virginian" (Adkins), lives his life as a ranch enforcer with bravery and steely determination. When a big-city writer (Penny) raises questions about...

a 'Coffee Shop' brings all walks of life together

show.description: Directed by Dave Alan Johnson. With Laura Vandervoort, Cory M. Grant, Josh Ventura, Jason Burkey. When a young coffee shop owner is threatened with repossession she must take a chance with life and love as she fights to save her business.

show.description: Directed by Peter DeLuise. With Jesse Hutch, Willie Aames, Tony Alcantar, Lynda Boyd. After her family goes bankrupt, a city woman travels to the country to fix up a struggling pumpkin farm that her father bought as an investment.

show.description: Directed by John Ward. With Jana Kramer, Gerald McRaney, Randy Wayne, Shaun Sipos. The story of a girl who abandoned her family for the big city, returns home to the heart of the country. She finds values and love there that her life was missing. You can always go home.

Two young girls track down the legendary Black Stallion before it falls into the wrong hands.

show.description: Directed by Craig Clyde. With Connie Sellecca, Fred Ward, Miranda Cosgrove, Danielle Chuchran. A story about two girls, CJ and Hanna. CJ lives on a ranch, Hanna comes to visit and decides to photograph wild horses for a school project. The girls become great friends and learn of a plot that might jeopardize the mustangs.
